page.title: 20TRANSPORT 2
page.content: At Marshside the only transport in the area is your own, for example: Car, Motor Cycle, ect. The only main road is the A229 Thanet Way. There are{no {buses or trains,}the nearest railway station is at Herne Bay and it is 6 mile away. Marshside like most other villages has its share of{O.A.P's}and they have to be self sufficient. Just about everyone who can afford a car has one, but they also keep a bike no matter who they are. Without a car if you want to go shopping or travel by train it will cost you Â£4.00 return by taxi. A heavy{fall of snow}can seal the community in until local farmers fix{snow ploughs}to their tractors. In summary, the transport facilities in the area are very poor, perhaps the worst in this end of Kent. However, the area can at least boast an airfield.
